lead_paragraph: Germany, the defending champion, sent a message with its 11-0 romp against Argentina in the Women’s World Cup opener in Shanghai. Germany set Women’s World Cup records for goals and the largest margin of victory. The previous record for the most lopsided result was 8-0, twice: Sweden against Japan in 1991, and Norway against Nigeria in 1995. The No. 1-ranked Americans play North Korea in Group B today.
